p: Further understanding of the mutational and evolutionary procedures related to influenza viruses can help us develop prediction models. Prediction models are very important for vaccine production. Most of the predictive modeling studies focus on the surface protein hemagglutinin ( 49). Hemagglutinin DNA sequences for thousands of influenza A strains, isolated over the last 40 years, are freely available in electronic databases ( 50). However, prediction studies and experimental evolution studies are very challenging. Currently, available tools are not adequate for a reliable approach. More details can be found in the recently published reviews ( 51) and ( 52).
